content: @WG-rustc-dev-guide :wave: we have a meeting today, in ~ 2hs 13m
was talking with @Joshua Nelson about it, I didn't have time to do stuff but @Joshua Nelson did some stuff
I wasn't quite as busy this month as previously, but I still made a few changes

these are the big ones:

  • move the bootstrapping section later in the guide (https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/pull/975) - this could use review!
  • document 'sysroot' https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/pull/976
  • add troubleshooting tips for git issues https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/pull/974
  • update the README and make the line length script more friendly https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/pull/973
unfortunately I did not get done anything I said I'd do at the last meeting :laughing:
speaking of which - @I単aki Garay did you ever get a chance to look at https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/issues/949 ?
https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/issues/942 is making a lot of progress building rustdoc in tree actually: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79540
I would love for people to build rustdoc without having to wait half an hour the first time

Joshua Nelson said:

speaking of which - I単aki Garay did you ever get a chance to look at https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/issues/949 ?

Yes, and I didn't answer immediately because I 1) wanted to finish the short text on tracing.rs so as to be able to link to it and 2) because I didn't have that prototype working, and I also wanted to link to that. But, I haven't been able to finish those. In short, I procrastinated via search for perfection.

I will post a short answer there right now.

At least, I'm almost done the short intro to tracing, and then we can talk more about https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/pull/975
It might not make that much sense after all
as I've said above didn't have much time
hope to have something for next meeting
unsure if someone wants to comment something else
otherwise we can call it a day I guess
Sorry, I know I've been missing all the meetings recently! Things should ease up a bit after January (hopefully).
